page.title: 03WILDLIFE West Forres
page.content: The most common animals in our area are hares,rabbits,red squirrels and roe deer.There are quite a few rarer animals too:badgers;pinemartens ; goshawks ;peregrine falcons and ospreys.Some students have been studying bats in this area and have found four different kinds:Natterer's Bat ; Pipistrelles ;Long_eared and Water Bats.The nearest recorded sighting of the Natterer's Bat is at Glasgow.Present day estate owners make a studied effort to protect the wildlife on their estates unlike their Victorian ancestors whose main interest was to hunt and display collections of their trophies.Although the osprey has only recently started to breed in Britain and is considered very rare there are several breeding sites in the area.
